criteria: Use of Visual Fraction Models and Equations
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of fraction division concepts.  Unable to explain or apply the concept of dividing fractions.
Student demonstrates a limited understanding of fraction division.  Struggles to explain or apply the concept, even with assistance.
Student demonstrates a partial understanding of fraction division. Can perform simple calculations with significant errors or requires prompting.
Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of fraction division. Can perform calculations with some errors and can explain the concept with prompting.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of fraction division. Can accurately perform calculations and explain the concept clearly.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of fraction division. Can accurately perform calculations, explain the concept clearly, and apply it to novel situations.
Student makes numerous errors in fraction division calculations, indicating a lack of procedural fluency.
Student makes frequent errors in fraction division calculations, demonstrating a weak grasp of the procedure.
Student makes some errors in fraction division calculations, but shows some understanding of the procedure.
Student makes occasional errors in fraction division calculations, but generally demonstrates competence.
Student makes few errors in fraction division calculations, demonstrating a high level of accuracy.
Student makes no errors in fraction division calculations, demonstrating mastery of the procedure.
Student is unable to apply fraction division to solve word problems. Cannot identify the operation needed or set up the problem correctly.
Student struggles to apply fraction division to solve word problems. May identify the correct operation but has difficulty setting up the problem.
Student can apply fraction division to solve simple word problems with significant errors.  Requires significant guidance.
Student can apply fraction division to solve most word problems with some errors.  Can set up the problem correctly with some assistance.
Student can apply fraction division to solve word problems accurately. Can set up the problem correctly and arrive at the correct solution.
Student can apply fraction division to solve complex word problems accurately and efficiently. Can explain their reasoning clearly and justify their solution.
Student does not use visual fraction models or equations to represent fraction division problems.
Student attempts to use visual fraction models or equations, but they are inaccurate or do not represent the problem correctly.
Student uses visual fraction models or equations with some accuracy, but they may be incomplete or unclear.
Student uses visual fraction models or equations effectively to represent fraction division problems, but there may be minor errors.
Student uses visual fraction models or equations accurately and effectively to represent fraction division problems.
Student uses visual fraction models or equations creatively and effectively to represent and solve fraction division problems, demonstrating a deep understanding of the concepts.
